title: Former Thomas Cook worker sells wedding dress on eBay to make ends meet
text:

A former Thomas Cook worker who lost her job when the company collapsed is selling her wedding dress to make ends meet.

The woman from Taunton, Somerset, has put the intricate white gown up for sale for £500 in order to pay her bills.

Not only did the dress owner lose her job, her husband also worked for the firm.

Times have got so tight that she put the dress up for sale at £900 less than she bought it for.

“Brand New Stella York wedding dress size 10. RRP £1400," the dress advert reads.

“Has not been altered brand new never worn stunning dress. Me and my husband were both made redundant form Thomas Cook and it has turned our world upside down. I am seeking this dress to help pay for up and coming bills.

(Image: Ebay)

(Image: Ebay)

“Collection or can send with a courier, price to be confirmed as would need to know where to send to get a quote. It will be sent recorded with courier so you can track it.”

Other former employees of the historic travel firm have found ways to make a bit of cash now their regular incomes have gone.

Some have flogged their Thomas Cook uniforms, with a full female flight attendant get-up fetching £100.

Others put a price on their used tights.

One woman from Kent advertised the hosiery she wore on her last flight for £20.50 on eBay.

For a lot of people, finding themselves out of a job they loved has had a big emotional impact.

(Image: BPM Media)

One crew member on board the flight from Larnaca in Cyprus back to Birmingham broke into tears as they spoke to their final load of passengers over the loudspeaker.

"Some of you might be confused why you are travelling on a Thomas Cook-branded aircraft with ex Thomas Cook staff as well," they said.

"Unfortunately all of us lost our jobs on Monday which have just been taken from beneath us. It's very upsetting.

"The cabin grew have been extremely brave in putting their uniforms on, but we just wanted to ensure that we were able to come to work and bring you back with our Thomas Cook crew that took you out.

"I think this is the last time for myself that I will be reading out this demonstration for you."
description: A former employee of the now collapsed travel firm is one of a number of out of work staff selling clothes to pay the bills
